trans-unit.source: How to configure Microsoft Account authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Microsoft Account authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Microsoft Account authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Microsoft Account authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your App Service application to use Microsoft Account login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your App Service application to use Microsoft Account login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Service to use Microsoft Account as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Service to use Microsoft Account as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: Register your Windows app at the Windows Dev Center
trans-unit.target: Register your Windows app at the Windows Dev Center

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows apps and Windows store apps must be registered through the Windows Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows apps and Windows store apps must be registered through the Windows Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to more more easily configure push notifications for your app in the future.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to more more easily configure push notifications for your app in the future.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Skip this section for Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and all other non-Windows apps.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Skip this section for Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and all other non-Windows apps.

trans-unit.source: If you have already configured push notifications for your Windows app, you can also skip this section.
trans-unit.target: If you have already configured push notifications for your Windows app, you can also skip this section.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Copy your **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy your **URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your app with Microsoft Account.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your app with Microsoft Account.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Windows Dev Center](https://dev.windows.com/dashboard/Application/New), log on with your Microsoft account, type a name for your app, verify its availability, then click **Reserve app name**.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Windows Dev Center](https://dev.windows.com/dashboard/Application/New), log on with your Microsoft account, type a name for your app, verify its availability, then click **Reserve app name**.

trans-unit.source: Open your Windows app project in Visual Studio, then in Solution Explorer right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Store** > **Associate App with the Store...**.
trans-unit.target: Open your Windows app project in Visual Studio, then in Solution Explorer right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Store** > **Associate App with the Store...**.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and sign-in with your Microsoft account, select the app name you reserved, then click **Next** > **Associate**.
trans-unit.target: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and sign-in with your Microsoft account, select the app name you reserved, then click **Next** > **Associate**.

trans-unit.source: For a universal Windows 8.1 app, you must repeat steps 4 and 5 for the Windows Phone Store project.
trans-unit.target: For a universal Windows 8.1 app, you must repeat steps 4 and 5 for the Windows Phone Store project.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services** > **Push notifications**.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services** > **Push notifications**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Push notifications** page, click **Live Services site** under **Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) and Microsoft Azure Mobile Services**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Push notifications** page, click **Live Services site** under **Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) and Microsoft Azure Mobile Services**.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will configure Microsoft account authentication for your Windows app.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will configure Microsoft account authentication for your Windows app.

trans-unit.source: Register your app with Microsoft Account
trans-unit.target: Register your app with Microsoft Account

trans-unit.source: If you have already registered your Windows app in the previous section, you can skip to step 4.
trans-unit.target: If you have already registered your Windows app in the previous section, you can skip to step 4.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Copy your **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy your **URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your app with Microsoft Account.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your app with Microsoft Account.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the [My Applications] page in the Microsoft Account Developer Center, and log on with your Microsoft account, if required.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the [My Applications] page in the Microsoft Account Developer Center, and log on with your Microsoft account, if required.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create application**, then type an **Application name** and click **I accept**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create application**, then type an **Application name** and click **I accept**.

trans-unit.source: Click **API Settings**, select **Yes** for **Mobile or desktop client app**, supply the **Redirect URL** for your application, then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **API Settings**, select **Yes** for **Mobile or desktop client app**, supply the **Redirect URL** for your application, then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Your redirect URI is the URL of your application appended with the path, _/.auth/login/microsoftaccount/callback_.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Your redirect URI is the URL of your application appended with the path, _/.auth/login/microsoftaccount/callback_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/microsoftaccount/callback`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/microsoftaccount/callback`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Settings** and make a note of the values of the **Client ID** and **Client secret**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Settings** and make a note of the values of the **Client ID** and **Client secret**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The client secret is an important security credential.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The client secret is an important security credential.

trans-unit.source: Do not share the client secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.
trans-unit.target: Do not share the client secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.

trans-unit.source: Add Microsoft Account information to your App Service application
trans-unit.target: Add Microsoft Account information to your App Service application

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application, click **Settings** > **Authentication / Authorization**.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application, click **Settings** > **Authentication / Authorization**.

trans-unit.source: If the Authentication / Authorization feature is not enabled, switch it **On**.
trans-unit.target: If the Authentication / Authorization feature is not enabled, switch it **On**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Microsoft Account**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Microsoft Account**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the App ID and App Secret values which you obtained previously, and optionally enable any scopes your application requires.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the App ID and App Secret values which you obtained previously, and optionally enable any scopes your application requires.

trans-unit.source: Then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.
trans-unit.target: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.

trans-unit.source: You must authorize users in your app code.
trans-unit.target: You must authorize users in your app code.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Microsoft account, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Microsoft Account**.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Microsoft account, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Microsoft Account**.

trans-unit.source: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Microsoft account for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Microsoft account for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Microsoft Account for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Microsoft Account for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: Related content
trans-unit.target: Related content
